overview.description: MyFbFramework is a library for the FreeBasic programming language, commonly abbreviated as MFF. A forms building and drawing library for FreeBasic with VB.NET-like syntax

list.name: Animate
list.desc: Displays AVI clips

list.name: Chart
list.desc: Interactive chart object

list.name: CheckBox
list.desc: Toggle selection control

list.name: CheckedListBox
list.desc: Displays a ListBox in which a check box is displayed to the left of each item.

list.name: ComboBoxEdit
list.desc: Combines the features of a TextBox and a ListControl.

list.name: ComboBoxEx
list.desc: ComboBoxEx is an enhanced version of ComboBoxEdit, inheriting its core functionality while adding advanced features such as the ability to display images for each item.

list.name: CommandButton
list.desc: Looks like a push button and is used to begin, interrupt, or end a process.

list.name: DateTimePicker
list.desc: Represents a Windows control that allows the user to select a date and a time and to display the date and time with a specified format.

list.name: Grid
list.desc: Defines a flexible grid area that consists of columns and rows.

list.name: Header
list.desc: A header control is a window that is usually positioned above columns of text or numbers.

list.name: HotKey
list.desc: A hot key control is a window that enables the user to enter a combination of keystrokes to be used as a hot key.

list.name: HScrollBar
list.desc: Provides a horizontal scroll bar for easy navigation through long lists of items.

list.name: ImageBox
list.desc: Displays a graphic.

list.name: IPAddress
list.desc: An Internet Protocol (IP) address control allows the user to enter an IP address in an easily understood format.

list.name: Label
list.desc: Displays text that a user can't change directly.

list.name: LinkLabel
list.desc: Represents a label control that can display hyperlinks.

list.name: ListControl
list.desc: Displays a list of items from which the user can select one or more.

list.name: ListView
list.desc: Represents a control that displays a list of data items.

list.name: MonthCalendar
list.desc: Represents a control that enables the user to select a date using a visual monthly calendar display.

list.name: NumericUpDown
list.desc: Represents a spin box (also known as an up-down control) that displays numeric values.

list.name: OpenFileControl
list.desc: Represents a box for choosing files.

list.name: PrintPreviewControl
list.desc: Represents the raw preview part of print previewing, without any dialog boxes or buttons.

list.name: ProgressBar
list.desc: A progress bar is a window that an application can use to indicate the progress of a lengthy operation.

list.name: RadioButton
list.desc: Displays an option that can be turned on or off.

list.name: RichTextBox
list.desc: The RichTextBox control enables you to display or edit flow content including paragraphs, images, tables, and more.

list.name: ScrollBarControl
list.desc: Provides a horizontal and a vertical scroll bar for easy navigation through long lists of items.

list.name: SearchBox
list.desc: A subclass of TextBox that has been tailored for use as a search textbox.

list.name: Splitter
list.desc: Represents a splitter control that enables the user to resize docked controls.

list.name: StatusBar
list.desc: A status bar is a horizontal window at the bottom of a parent window in which an application can display various kinds of status information.

list.name: TextBox
list.desc: Displays information entered at design time by the user, or in code at run time.

list.name: ToolBar
list.desc: A toolbar is a control that contains one or more buttons.

list.name: ToolPalette
list.desc: A tool palette with categories.

list.name: ToolTips
list.desc: An element in which, when hovering over a marker or region element or component, a text box displays information about that element.

list.name: TrackBar
list.desc: A trackbar is a window that contains a slider (sometimes called a thumb) in a channel, and optional tick marks.

list.name: TreeListView
list.desc: Combines the features of a TreeView and a ListView.

list.name: TreeView
list.desc: Represents a control that displays hierarchical data in a tree structure that has items that can expand and collapse.

list.name: UpDown
list.desc: An up-down control is a pair of arrow buttons that the user can click to increment or decrement a value, such as a scroll position or a number displayed in a companion control (called a buddy window).

list.name: VScrollBar
list.desc: Provides a vertical scroll bar.

list.name: WebBrowser
list.desc: Enables the user to navigate Web pages inside your form.

list.name: Form
list.desc: Application window

list.name: GroupBox
list.desc: Control grouping container

list.name: HorizontalBox
list.desc: Arranges items in a horizontal row.

list.name: PagePanel
list.desc: Used to organize controls on hidden panels.

list.name: PageScroller
list.desc: The PageScroller control is used to scroll a panel along with the components placed on it.

list.name: Panel
list.desc: Used to group collections of controls.

list.name: Picture
list.desc: Displays a graphic from a bitmap, icon or metafile.

list.name: ReBar
list.desc: A Rebar control acts as a container for child windows. It can contain one or more bands, and each band can have any combination of a gripper bar, a bitmap, a text label, and one child window.

list.name: ScrollControl
list.desc: A container that makes its child scrollable.

list.name: TabControl
list.desc: Represents a control that contains multiple items that share the same space on the screen.

list.name: TabPage
list.desc: Represents a single tab page in a TabControl.

list.name: UserControl
list.desc: Provides an empty control that can be used to create other controls. A Control authored in VisualFBEditor

list.name: VerticalBox
list.desc: Arranges items in a vertical column.

list.name: HTTPConnection
list.desc: Constructs a connection to the host (port) as given in the url.

list.name: HTTPServer
list.desc: Implements a simple HTTP server.

list.name: ImageList
list.desc: An image list is a collection of images of the same size, each of which can be referred to by its index.

list.name: MainMenu
list.desc: Represents the menu structure of a form.

list.name: MariaDBBox
list.desc: A container that provides a pre-installed and configured environment for working with the MariaDB database.

list.name: PopUpMenu
list.desc: Represents a context menu.

list.name: PrintDocument
list.desc: Defines a reusable object that sends output to a printer, when printing.

list.name: Printer
list.desc: Enables you to communicate with a system printer (initially the default printer).

list.name: SQLite3Component
list.desc: A component that facilitates integration with the SQLite3 database.

list.name: TimerComponent
list.desc: A control which can execute code at regular intervals by causing a Timer event.

list.name: ColorDialog
list.desc: Color selection dialog

list.name: OpenFileDialog
list.desc: File open dialog

list.name: FolderBrowserDialog
list.desc: Prompts the user to select a folder.

list.name: FontDialog
list.desc: Prompts the user to choose a font from among those installed on the local computer.

list.name: PageSetupDialog
list.desc: Enables users to change page-related print settings, including margins and paper orientation.

list.name: PrintDialog
list.desc: Lets users select a printer and choose which sections of the document to print from an application.

list.name: PrintPreviewDialog
list.desc: Represents the raw preview part of print previewing from an application.

list.name: SaveFileDialog
list.desc: Prompts the user to select a location for saving a file.

control_cross_reference.reference_doc: MyFbFramework VB VB.NET Control Cross-Reference Table.md

external_implementation: Declare event handlers OUTSIDE form class:
Ensure event handlers match the subroutine signatures used in Cast function.
event Binding Syntax: CastSubByRef` is not recognized as a valid macro or function
Cast(Sub(ByRef Designer As My.Sys.Object, ByRef Sender As CheckBox), @[ControlName]_Click)
Add the required parenthesis pair after the Sub declaration, Match parameter types between declarations and casts
menu_specific: Use MenuItem.Tag property for command identification
Handle multiple commands with SELECT CASE structure

code_structure_example.header:
'#Region "Form"
 #if defined(__FB_MAIN__) AndAlso Not defined(__MAIN_FILE__)
  #define __MAIN_FILE__
  #ifdef __FB_WIN32__
   #cmdline "Form1.rc"
  #endif  Const _MAIN_FILE_ = __FILE__
 #endif
 #include once "mff/Form.bi"
 #include once "mff/CommandButton.bi"
 
 Using My.Sys.Forms
code_structure_example.form_type:
Type Form1Type Extends Form
  Declare Sub CommandButton1_Click(ByRef Sender As Control)
  Declare Sub CommandButton1_Paint(ByRef Sender As Control, ByRef Canvas As My.Sys.Drawing.Canvas)
  Declare Constructor
   Dim As CommandButton CommandButton1(1)
 End Type
code_structure_example.constructor:
Constructor Form1Type
  #if _MAIN_FILE_ = __FILE__
   With App
    .CurLanguagePath = ExePath & "/Languages/"
    .CurLanguage = My.Sys.Language
   End With
  #endif
  ' Form1
  With This
   .Name = "Form1"
   .Text = "Form1"
   .Designer = @This
   .SetBounds 0, 0, 350, 300
  End With
  ' CommandButton1(0)
  With CommandButton1(0)
   .Name = "CommandButton1(0)"
   .Text = "CommandButton1(0)"
   .TabIndex = 0
   .SetBounds 42, 93, 121, 32
   .Designer = @This
   .OnClick = Cast(Sub(ByRef Designer As My.Sys.Object, ByRef Sender As Control), @CommandButton1_Click)
   .OnPaint = Cast(Sub(ByRef Designer As My.Sys.Object, ByRef Sender As Control, ByRef Canvas As My.Sys.Drawing.Canvas), @CommandButton1_Paint)
   .Parent = @This
  End With
  ' CommandButton1(1)
  With CommandButton1(1)
   .Name = "CommandButton1(1)"
   .Text = "CommandButton1(0)"
   .TabIndex = 1
   .ControlIndex = 0
   .SetBounds 168, 95, 121, 32
   .Designer = @This
   .Parent = @This
  End With
 End Constructor
code_structure_example.application_start:
Dim Shared Form1 As Form1Type
 
 #if _MAIN_FILE_ = __FILE__
  App.DarkMode = True
  Form1.MainForm = True
  Form1.Show
  App.Run
 #endif
 '#End Region

external_handler.click_handler:
Private Sub Form1Type.CommandButton1_Click(ByRef Sender As Control)
 Dim As Integer Index = Val(Mid(Sender.Name, InStrRev(Sender.Name, "(") + 1))
End Sub
external_handler.paint_handler:
Private Sub Form1Type.CommandButton1_Paint(ByRef Sender As Control, ByRef Canvas As My.Sys.Drawing.Canvas)
 Dim As Integer Index = Val(Mid(Sender.Name, InStrRev(Sender.Name, "(") + 1))
End Sub
